properties.areaDesc: Morgan; Franklin; Colbert; Marshall; Cullman; DeKalb; Lawrence
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 7:02AM CST by NWS Huntsville AL
properties.description:
Low stratus clouds and patchy dense fog will continue to develop
northward into the region from central Alabama this morning, with
visibilities occasionally being reduced to less than one half of a
mile in a few locations. The threat for locally dense fog will be
highest in counties south of the Tennessee River through 9 AM CST.

Motorists are urged to drive with extreme caution, as visibilities
will vary significantly given the patchy nature of the fog. Use low
beams, reduce driving speed, and allow for plenty of room between you
and other cars.

Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio, or a favorite local media outlet,
for further statements or updates from the National Weather Service
in Huntsville.

NWSheadline: Significant Weather Advisory for Patchy Dense Fog across portions of north Alabama to the south of the Tennessee River
